com.example.stanza

Class LoginActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.stanza.LoginActivity

  • public class LoginActivity
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to allow the user to login to the Stanza ap.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Upon creation of the activity, all view fields (for email and password) are initiated and onClickListeners for the login button and signup link are set up. An instance of AccountCommThread is initiated for communication with the backend.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - a reference to a Bundle object passed into the Activity

      • onRestart

        public void onRestart()
        Upon restarting the activity, an instance of AccountCommThread will be initialized.

      • login

        public void login()
        Called when the login button is pressed. First checks if the account information is valid. If it is, then an AccountCommThread is initiated to check whether the account information is a valid email/password combination. If it is, the user will be logged into the app. If it is not, then invalidLoginAttempt() will be called.

      • onActivityResult

        protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                                int resultCode,
                                Intent data)
        Called upon successful completion of SignupActivity. If creating an account was successful, the user will be automatically logged into the app.
        Parameters:
        requestCode - The activity code sent to SignupActivity.
        resultCode - The result code received from SignupActivity.
        data - The intent used to start the SignupActivity.

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        Override the back button in this activity such that this activity is the only one visible to the user prior to a successful login.

      • invalidLoginAttempt

        public void invalidLoginAttempt()
        Called if the login information is invalid. Displays a message to the user to this effect.

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
        Ensure that the information (email, and password) are valid entries. Specifically, that the password meet the minimum/maximum character requirements and that the email is actually an email. Set an error message if any of these conditions are not satisfied
        Returns:
        True/false depending on whether the account information entered is valid.

      • onServerDisconnected

        public void onServerDisconnected()
        Called from an instance of AccountCommThread if connection to the backend is unsuccessful.

      • onLoginSuccess

        public void onLoginSuccess()
        Called from an instance of AccountCommThread if login is successful. The email used to login will be saved as the user for use in publishing poems, and the user will be allowed into the app.

      • onLoginFailed

        public void onLoginFailed(java.lang.String error_message)
        Called from an instance of AccountCommThread if login fails. This will occur if the user has entered an invalid email/password combination. Will display an error message describing the issue.
        Parameters:
        error_message - A message describing what the login error is.

      • onSignupSuccess

        public void onSignupSuccess()

      • onSignupFailed

        public void onSignupFailed(java.lang.String error_message)

      • onFriendSuccess

        public void onFriendSuccess(java.lang.String name)

      • onFriendFailure

        public void onFriendFailure(java.lang.String error_message)
